name: Straight-arm Pull Down
how_to_perform:
1. Sit on the edge of a high bench or step with your feet flat on the floor, ensuring your body is directly over your hips and your back straight.
 
2. Lean forward slightly by bending at the hips, keeping your back straight and maintaining an upright posture.

3. Hold onto lat pull-down bar with hands shoulder-width apart, avoiding overlap of fingers.
4. Engage core muscles to maintain straight posture while lifting arms upwards towards ceiling.

5. Slowly lift both hands in a straight line above shoulders by pulling down on the bar,
6. Focus contraction in lats muscles as arms reach overhead position.

7. Pause at peak contraction for brief moment, avoiding swinging motion.
8. Control your movement and slowly return to starting point.
9. Repeat desired repetitions under guidance of trainer or coach.
short_summary: Straight-arm pull down engages lat muscles while lifting upper arm into a straight line with shoulders, requiring back extensor control for proper execution.
